comment: He really is not understanding, & requires you to print out so many things. He doesn't clearly state online what forms to print for each project. The instructions he gives are not clear. I don't really feel like I'm learning in this class, it's almost like the students are teaching each other.

He often canceled class without much notice whatsoever, which was quite a pain for those who live outside of the metropolitan area. He has a decent teaching style, but nothing too different or nuanced. Not very good at critique either, class critiques were unhelpful because he only ever talked about good students' artwork.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Prof. He only lectures from powerpoint and his powerpoints are straight from the chapter in the text. He is easy to follow and his grades are only from 4 tests (which are easy). As long as you study the material you will pass. You'll also have a project that requires you to go to a museum but it is easy stuff. Highly recommend!

Expects a lot out of a class full of freshman. When he is disappointed with a class he chooses to share his distaste with other classes. Can be helpful but definitely make sure you have friends who will stick with you during class. Assignments can be hard but occasionally he will change the schedule if several people are having a hard time.

Mr. Hall was a great professor for Art in Society. Powerpoint is his method of teaching but he actually knows his material to keep you engaged. His slide count averages from 60-90. You have to be there in order to know what slides you will need to memorizes for the test. There were 4 tests(in class) total and 2 HW assign. w/ 1 in class assignment.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: We would literally have like 100 slides per lecture, we met twice a week so that's about 200 slides for that one week & by time test comes 500 slides for test w/no study guide. This class was harder than my math class!
